Articles.Content: Where is the Kopernicus Thread? Has it been deleted? I suddenly can't find it anywhere! If so, where do you want me to post questions about my kopernicus work?
I don't know what LMGTFY means, but thanks!

"Let Me Google That For You" - quite an impressive search engine that is. Usually finds what you are looking for.

Edited May 29, 2016 by JPLRepo

So this has already been answered, but seeing as this is the second time you've posted this exact same thread with the exact same problem, I decided to look into it.

  • Using the built-in search engine: It's the #1 returned result. See pic below.
  • Alternatively, if you really can't find a thread (which does happen occasionally), but you know someone who runs it or is affiliated with it, you could do a Search by Members and navigate to their profile. Searching for "Thomas P" or "KillAshley" would probably get you to the same end result in a few more clicks (and probably yields some other informative threads as well).
  • You could also try Bookmarking the thread, which has been a feature in web browsers since at least Netscape Navigator. It works pretty well, and also comes with a search feature.
  • Likewise, if you've been to the thread in the past, you could check your History tab.

The Kopernicus Kats are a great bunch of people who literally make (virtual) worlds for us to explore and play on. They're usually quite happy to answer questions, but like all modders around here, are also incredibly busy. Threads like "How do I use the Internet" (my words) just create clutter and are really outside the purview of this sub-forum.

Otherwise, good luck creating worlds (Kerbiting Planets, I think was your pack last I checked?) and have a nice day.
